newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Piltel jumps 15 pct in early trade.
newsitem.headline: Piltel jumps 15 pct in early trade.

text.p: Cellular phone company Pilipino Telephone Corp rose by 1.50 pesos, or 15 pct, to 11.50 pesos on foreign buying, traders said.

"The stock has been battered and probably some investors are buying it back in view of its very cheap levels. Also, they probably expect some improvement in the anti-cloning measures that the firm has put in place in the first quarter," said Helen Alvarez, research director at All Asia Securities.
Dharmala Securities analyst Manuel Goseco said foreign investors were seen buying the issue.
Piltel was the most active issue early in the session with 97.7 million pesos worth of shares traded.
Cloning refer to fraudulent calls made by people using sophisticated cloning devices. Piltel was hit last year by a severe revenue problem on account of the fraud calls.
